intro: Consolida regalis var. glanduligera, commonly known as the glandular sweet rocket, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring compound leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens and rocky habitats. The glandular hairs on its stems and leaves are a distinguishing botanical feature.
